briefdescription.para: Maximum message size.
End of file message.
Maximum number of channels.
Message buffer structure.
Input queue structure. Contains information on an input queue.
Output queue structure. Contains information on an output queue.
Remote Procedure Call (RPC) structure. Contains information required to coordinate sending/receiving response/requests from/to an RPC server/client.

detaileddescription.para: Remote Procedure Call (RPC) IO
Handle IO case of a server receiving input from clients, performing some calculation, and then sending a response back to the client.

Clients can also send several requests at once before receiving any responses. This allows the server to be processing the next requests while the client handles the previous response, thereby increasing efficiency. The responses are assumed to be in the same order as the generating requests (i.e. first come, first served).

briefdescription.para: Structure of information for output to a file line by line.

detaileddescription.para: File IO
Handle I/O from/to a local or remote file line by line.

briefdescription.para: Structure of information for input from a file line by line.
Structure for handling output to an ASCII table.

detaileddescription.para: Table IO
Handle I/O from/to a local or remote ASCII table either line-by-line or as an array.

briefdescription.para: Structure for handling input from an ASCII table.
Names of channels in use.
Number of channels in use.
Print a log message. Prints a formatted message, prepending it with the process id and appending it with a newline.

detaileddescription.para: Logging

Alliases are set at compile-time based on the value of PSI_CLIENT_DEBUG. If set to INFO, only messages logged with info or error alias are printed. If set to DEBUG, messages logged with error, info or debug aliases are printed. Otherwise, only error messages are printed. If the PSI_CLIENT_DEBUG is changed, any code including this header must be recompiled for the change to take effect.

parameterdescription.para: a constant character pointer to the prefix that should preceed the message and process id.
a constant character pointer to a format string.
va_list of arguments to be formatted in the format string.

briefdescription.para: Print an info log message. Prints a formatted message, prepending it with INFO and the process id. A newline character is added to the end of the message.

parameterdescription.para: a constant character pointer to a format string.
arguments to be formatted in the format string.

briefdescription.para: Print an debug log message. Prints a formatted message, prepending it with DEBUG and the process id. A newline character is added to the end of the message.

parameterdescription.para: a constant character pointer to a format string.
arguments to be formatted in the format string.

briefdescription.para: Print an error log message. Prints a formatted message, prepending it with ERROR and the process id. A newline character is added to the end of the message.

parameterdescription.para: a constant character pointer to a format string.
arguments to be formatted in the format string.

briefdescription.para: Get a sysv_ipc queue identifier based on its name. The queue name is used to locate the queue key stored in the associated environment variable. That key is then used to get the queue ID.

detaileddescription.para: Basic IO

parameterdescription.para: character pointer to name of environment variable that the queue key should be shored in.
constant character pointer to the original name of the queue, absent any suffix. This is used to check if there is an existing queue with that name, but a different suffix.

simplesect.para: int queue identifier.

briefdescription.para: Check if a character array matches the internal EOF message.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to string that should be checked.

simplesect.para: int 1 if buf is the EOF message, 0 otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiOutput_t structure. Create a psiOutput_t structure based on a provided name that is used to locate a particular sysv_ipc queue key stored in the environment variable name + "_OUT".

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to name of queue.

simplesect.para: psiOutput_t output queue structure.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiInput_t structure. Create a psiInput_t structure based on a provided name that is used to locate a particular sysv_ipc queue key stored in the environment variable name + "_IN".

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to name of queue.

simplesect.para: psiInput_t input queue structure.

briefdescription.para: Alias for psiOutput.
Alias for psiInput.

Constructor for psiOutput_t structure with format. Create a psiOutput_t structure based on a provided name that is used to locate a particular sysv_ipc queue key stored in the environment variable name + "_OUT" and a format string that can be used to format arguments into outgoing messages for the queue.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to name of queue.
character pointer to format string.

simplesect.para: psiOutput_t output queue structure.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiInput_t structure with format. Create a psiInput_t structure based on a provided name that is used to locate a particular sysv_ipc queue key stored in the environment variable name + "_IN" and a format stirng that can be used to extract arguments from messages received from the queue.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to name of queue.
character pointer to format string.

simplesect.para: psiInput_t input queue structure.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of messages in an output queue. Check how many messages are waiting in the associated queue for an output queue structure.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t output queue structure.

simplesect.para: int number of messages in the queue. -1 if the queue cannot be accessed.

briefdescription.para: Get the number of messages in an input queue. Check how many messages are waiting in the associated queue for an input queue structure.

parameterdescription.para: psiInput_t input queue structure.

simplesect.para: int number of messages in the queue. -1 if the queue cannot be accessed.

briefdescription.para: Send a message to an output queue. Send a message smaller than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes to an output queue. If the message is larger, it will not be sent.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that queue should be sent to.
character pointer to message that should be sent.
int length of message to be sent.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Receive a message from an input queue. Receive a message smaller than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes from an input queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that message should be sent to.
character pointer to allocated buffer where the message should be saved.
int length of the allocated message buffer in bytes.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received. Length of the received message if message was received.

briefdescription.para: Send a large message to an output queue. Send a message larger than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes to an output queue by breaking it up between several smaller messages and sending initial message with the size of the message that should be expected. Must be partnered with psi_recv_nolimit for communication to make sense.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that message should be sent to.
character pointer to message that should be sent.
int length of message to be sent.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Receive a large message from an input queue. Receive a message larger than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes from an input queue by receiving it in parts. This expects the first message to be the size of the total message.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that message should be sent to.
character pointer to pointer for allocated buffer where the message should be stored. A pointer to a pointer is used so that the buffer may be reallocated as necessary for the incoming message.
int length of the initial allocated message buffer in bytes.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received. Length of the received message if message was received.

briefdescription.para: Send arguments as a small formatted message to an output queue. Use the format string to create a message from the input arguments that is then sent to the specified output queue. If the message is larger than PSI_MSG_MAX or cannot be encoded, it will not be sent.

detaileddescription.para: Formatted IO

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that queue should be sent to.
va_list arguments to be formatted into a message using sprintf.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Assign arguments by receiving and parsing a message from an input queue. Receive a message smaller than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes from an input queue and parse it using the associated format string.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that message should be sent to.
va_list arguments that should be assigned by parsing the received message using sscanf. As these are being assigned, they should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received or could not be parsed. Length of the received message if message was received and parsed.

briefdescription.para: Send arguments as a small formatted message to an output queue. Use the format string to create a message from the input arguments that is then sent to the specified output queue. If the message is larger than PSI_MSG_MAX or cannot be encoded, it will not be sent.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that queue should be sent to.
arguments to be formatted into a message using sprintf.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Assign arguments by receiving and parsing a message from an input queue. Receive a message smaller than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes from an input queue and parse it using the associated format string.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that message should be sent to.
arguments that should be assigned by parsing the received message using sscanf. As these are being assigned, they should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received or could not be parsed. Length of the received message if message was received and parsed.

briefdescription.para: Send arguments as a large formatted message to an output queue. Use the format string to create a message from the input arguments that is then sent to the specified output queue. The message can be larger than PSI_MSG_MAX. If it cannot be encoded, it will not be sent.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that queue should be sent to.
va_list arguments to be formatted into a message using sprintf.

simplesect.para: int 0 if formatting and send succesfull, -1 if formatting or send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Assign arguments by receiving and parsing a message from an input queue. Receive a message larger than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes in chunks from an input queue and parse it using the associated format string.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that message should be sent to.
va_list arguments that should be assigned by parsing the received message using sscanf. As these are being assigned, they should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received or could not be parsed. Length of the received message if message was received and parsed.

briefdescription.para: Send arguments as a large formatted message to an output queue. Use the format string to create a message from the input arguments that is then sent to the specified output queue. The message can be larger than PSI_MSG_MAX. If it cannot be encoded, it will not be sent.

parameterdescription.para: psiOutput_t structure that queue should be sent to.
arguments to be formatted into a message using sprintf.

simplesect.para: int 0 if formatting and send succesfull, -1 if formatting or send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Assign arguments by receiving and parsing a message from an input queue. Receive a message larger than PSI_MSG_MAX bytes in chunks from an input queue and parse it using the associated format string.

parameterdescription.para: psiInput_t structure that message should be sent to.
arguments that should be assigned by parsing the received message using sscanf. As these are being assigned, they should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received or could not be parsed. Length of the received message if message was received and parsed.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for RPC structure. Creates an instance of psiRpc_t with provided information.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer name of the output queue.
character pointer to format that should be used for formatting output.
constant character pointer to name of the input queue.
character pointer to format that should be used for parsing input.

simplesect.para: psiRpc_t structure with provided info.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for client side RPC structure. Creates an instance of psiRpc_t with provided information.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to name for queues.
character pointer to format that should be used for formatting output.
character pointer to format that should be used for parsing input.

simplesect.para: psiRpc_t structure with provided info.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for server side RPC structure. Creates an instance of psiRpc_t with provided information.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to name for queues.
character pointer to format that should be used for parsing input.
character pointer to format that should be used for formatting output.

simplesect.para: psiRpc_t structure with provided info.

briefdescription.para: Format and send a message to an RPC output queue. Format provided arguments list using the output queue format string and then sends it to the output queue under the assumption that it is larger than the maximum message size.

parameterdescription.para: psiRpc_t structure with RPC information.
va_list variable list of arguments for formatting.

simplesect.para: integer specifying if the send was succesful. Values >= 0 indicate success.

briefdescription.para: Receive and parse a message from an RPC input queue. Receive a message from the input queue under the assumption that it is larger than the maximum message size. Then parse the message using the input queue format string to extract parameters and assign them to the arguments.

parameterdescription.para: psiRpc_t structure with RPC information.

va_list variable list of arguments that should be assigned parameters extracted using the format string. Since these will be assigned, they should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: integer specifying if the receive was succesful. Values >= 0 indicate success.

briefdescription.para: Format and send a message to an RPC output queue. Format provided arguments using the output queue format string and then sends it to the output queue under the assumption that it is larger than the maximum message size.

parameterdescription.para: psiRpc_t structure with RPC information.
arguments for formatting.

simplesect.para: integer specifying if the send was succesful. Values >= 0 indicate success.

briefdescription.para: Receive and parse a message from an RPC input queue. Receive a message from the input queue under the assumption that it is larger than the maximum message size. Then parse the message using the input queue format string to extract parameters and assign them to the arguments.

parameterdescription.para: psiRpc_t structure with RPC information.
mixed arguments that should be assigned parameters extracted using the format string. Since these will be assigned, they should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: integer specifying if the receive was succesful. Values >= 0 indicate success.

briefdescription.para: Send request to an RPC server from the client and wait for a response. Format arguments using the output queue format string, send the message to the output queue, receive a response from the input queue, and assign arguments from the message using the input queue format string to parse it.

parameterdescription.para: psiRpc_t structure with RPC information.

va_list mixed arguments that include those that should be formatted using the output format string, followed by those that should be assigned parameters extracted using the input format string. These that will be assigned should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: integer specifying if the receive was succesful. Values >= 0 indicate success.

briefdescription.para: Send request to an RPC server from the client and wait for a response. Format arguments using the output queue format string, send the message to the output queue, receive a response from the input queue, and assign arguments from the message using the input queue format string to parse it.

parameterdescription.para: psiRpc_t structure with RPC information.

mixed arguments that include those that should be formatted using the output format string, followed by those that should be assigned parameters extracted using the input format string. These that will be assigned should be pointers to memory that has already been allocated.

simplesect.para: integer specifying if the receive was succesful. Values >= 0 indicate success.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiAsciiFileOutput_t. Based on the value of dst_type, either a local file will be opened for output (dst_type == 0), or a psiOutput_t connection will be made.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to path of local file or name of an output queue.
int 0 if name refers to a local file, 1 if it is a queue.

simplesect.para: psiAsciiFileOutput_t for line-by-line output to a file or channel.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiAsciiFileInput_t. Based on the value of src_type, either a local file will be opened for input (src_type == 0), or a psiInput_t connection will be made.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to path of local file or name of an input queue.
int 0 if name refers to a local file, 1 if it is a queue.

simplesect.para: psiAsciiFileInput_t for line-by-line input from a file or channel.

briefdescription.para: Send EOF message to output file, closing it.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiFileOutput_t output structure.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send was succesfull. All other values indicate errors.

briefdescription.para: Receive a single line from an associated file or queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiFileInput_t input structure.
character pointer to allocate memory where the received line should be stored.
size_t Size of the allocated memory block in bytes.

simplesect.para: int Number of bytes read/received. Negative values indicate that there was either an error or the EOF message was received.

briefdescription.para: Send a single line to a file or queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiFileOutput_t output structure.
character pointer to line that should be sent.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send was succesfull. Other values indicate errors.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate and clean up psiAsciiFileInput_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiFileInput_t pointer.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate and clean up psiAsciiFileOutput_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiFileOutput_t pointer.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiAsciiTableOutput_t.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to local file path or message queue name.
character pointer to format string that should be used to format rows into table lines.
int 0 if name is a local file path, 1 if it is the name of a message queue.

simplesect.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for psiAsciiTableInput_t.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to local file path or message queue name.
int 0 if name is a local file path, 1 if it is the name of a message queue.

simplesect.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t input structure.

briefdescription.para: Send a nolimit message to a table output queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.
character pointer to message that should be sent.
int length of message to be sent.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Recv a nolimit message from a table input queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t input structure.
character pointer to pointer to memory where received message should be stored. It does not need to be allocated, only defined.
int length of allocated buffer.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received. Length of the received message if message was received.

briefdescription.para: Send a nolimit EOF message to a table output queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Format and send a row to the table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.
va_list Row elements that should be formatted.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Recv and parse a row from the table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t input structure.
va_list Pointers to memory where variables from the parsed should be stored.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received or parsed, otherwise the length of the received is returned.

briefdescription.para: Format and send a row to the table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.
Row elements that should be formatted.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Recv and parse a row from the table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t input structure.
Pointers to memory where variables from the parsed row should be stored.

simplesect.para: int -1 if message could not be received or parsed, otherwise the length of the received is returned.

briefdescription.para: Format and send table columns to the table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.
int Number of rows in the columns.
va_list Pointers to memory containing table columns that should be formatted.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Recv and parse columns from a table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t input structure.
va_list Pointers to pointers to memory where columns from the parsed table should be stored. They need not be allocated, only declared.

simplesect.para: int Number of rows received. Negative values indicate errors.

briefdescription.para: Format and send table columns to the table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t output structure.
int Number of rows in the columns.
Pointers to memory containing table columns that should be formatted.

simplesect.para: int 0 if send succesfull, -1 if send unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Recv and parse columns from a table file/queue.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t input structure.
Pointers to pointers to memory where columns from the parsed table should be stored. They need not be allocated, only declared.

simplesect.para: int Number of rows received. Negative values indicate errors.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate and clean up psiAsciiTableInput_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableInput_t pointer.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate and clean up psiAsciiTableOutput_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: psiAsciiTableOutput_t pointer.
